summary: The Wall Street Tax Act of 2025 proposes to amend the Internal Revenue Code to impose a tax on certain trading transactions. The tax, starting at 0.02% in 2026 and increasing to 0.1% in 2030, applies to covered transactions involving securities, including stocks, bonds, and derivatives. The bill defines covered transactions, specifies who pays the tax, and includes exceptions like initial security issuances. It also outlines reporting requirements for controlled foreign corporations and sets an effective date of January 1, 2026.
